title: Causal Fourier Analysis on Directed Acyclic Graphs and Posets. (arXiv:2209.07970v3 [eess.SP] UPDATED)
abstract: We present a novel form of Fourier analysis, and associated signal processing concepts, for signals (or data) indexed by edge-weighted directed acyclic graphs (DAGs). This means that our Fourier basis yields an eigendecomposition of a suitable notion of shift and convolution operators that we define. DAGs are the common model to capture causal relationships between data values and in this case our proposed Fourier analysis relates data with its causes under a linearity assumption that we define. The definition of the Fourier transform requires the transitive closure of the weighted DAG for which several forms are possible depending on the interpretation of the edge weights. Examples include level of influence, distance, or pollution distribution. Our framework is different from prior GSP: it is specific to DAGs and leverages, and extends, the classical theory of Moebius inversion from combinatorics. translated_title: 有向无环图和偏序集上的因果傅里叶分析
translated_abstract: 我们提出了一种新颖的傅里叶分析形式，并提出了与之相关的信号处理概念，用于由带权有向无环图（DAG）索引的信号（或数据）。这意味着我们的傅里叶基函数可以将适当的移位和卷积算子进行特征分解，我们定义了这种算子。 DAG是捕捉数据值之间因果关系的常见模型，在本文中，我们的傅里叶分析将数据与其因果关系联系起来，其中采用了我们定义的线性假设。傅里叶变换的定义需要对加权DAG进行传递闭包处理，根据边权重的解释，可以有几种形式。示例包括影响水平、距离或污染分布。我们的框架不同于先前的图信号处理：它专门针对DAG并利用并扩展了组合数学中的经典模比乌斯反演理论。对于一个典型的应用，我们考虑了建模动态网络的DAGs，其中边线表示时间顺序和因果关系的强度。
tldr: 本文提出了一种用于有向无环图的新型傅里叶分析方法，通过特征分解转换信号，关联数据与其因果关系，扩展了组合数学中的经典模比乌斯反演理论。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces a novel form of Fourier analysis for directed acyclic graphs, which allows for the transformation of signals and the relationship between data and its causes. It extends the classical theory of Möbius inversion from combinatorics.
